background: A fitness enthusiast aiming to comply with dietary restrictions evaluates the composition of meals consisting of salmon and eggs to meet specific caloric and protein intake requirements while minimizing sodium consumption.
constraints: Number of salmon meals is non-negative
Number of egg meals is non-negative
At most MaxEggProportion of the meals can be eggs
Total caloric intake must be at least MinTotalCalories calories
Total protein intake must be at least MinTotalProtein grams
description: A macro-counting fitness guru only eats salmon and eggs. Each bowl of salmon contains \param{CaloriesSalmon} calories, \param{ProteinSalmon} grams of protein, and \param{SodiumSalmon} mg of sodium. Each bowl of eggs contains \param{CaloriesEggs} calories, \param{ProteinEggs} grams of protein, and \param{SodiumEggs} mg of sodium. Since the fitness guru has a limit to how many eggs he would like to eat, at most \param{MaxEggProportion} of his meals can be eggs. The fitness guru needs to eat at least \param{MinTotalCalories} calories and \param{MinTotalProtein} grams of protein. How many of each type of meal should he eat to minimize his sodium intake?

parameters.definition: Maximum proportion of meals that can be eggs
